cluster_relations.rel_desc: Seed dispersal enables plant species to reproduce and colonize new areas.
remarks: Seed dispersal is implied as the mechanism for plant reproduction and colonization.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Bird pollinators support the reproduction of many plant species; without them, these plants would struggle.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: in the absence of bird pollinators
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Effect: struggle to reproduce and maintain their populations

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (organism, agent, or process) functionally enables or supports the reproductive success and population maintenance of the object species.
args.justification: Both relations describe a functional/causal role in which the subject (seed dispersal, bird pollinators) enables or supports the reproduction and spread/maintenance of plant species. A single predicate 'facilitates_reproduction_of' captures this consistent, directional meaning without overfitting to a specific mechanism (pollination vs dispersal).

Both relations express that a subject provides necessary or beneficial support to the reproductive processes of plant species. Grouping them under a mid-level class 'reproductive_support_relation' captures this shared ecological function across different mechanisms (pollination, dispersal).

In both cases, the subject is framed as a causal or enabling factor for the reproductive success of the plant species; the descriptions emphasize dependence and consequences in the absence of the subject, fitting a causal/functional dependency grouping.

Both relations express that a subject provides necessary or beneficial support to the reproductive processes of plant species. Grouping them under a mid-level class 'reproductive_support_relation' captures this shared ecological function across different mechanisms (pollination, dispersal).
